definition: to hand over/to deliver/to pay (money)/to turn over/to make friends/to intersect (lines)/variant of 跤[jiao1]
to force/to compel/to approach or go towards/urgent/pressing
beset by hunger and cold (idiom)/starving and freezing/in desperate poverty

sentences.english: They bid farewell to the original suffer hunger and cold days.
sentences.chinese: 他們告別了當初飢寒交迫的日子。

sentences.english: In old society, he was miserable from cold and hunger.
sentences.chinese: 在舊社會，他受盡飢寒交迫之苦。

sentences.english: He suffered a great deal from cold and hunger.
Her life was devoted to caring for the sick and needy.
sentences.chinese: 她一生都致力於關心照顧貧病交迫的人。

sentences.english: People in the storm-stricken areas suffer from cold and hunger.
sentences.chinese: 遭受暴風雪侵襲地區的人們飢寒交迫。

sentences.english: Cold and hungry, he went back home.
They went to bed, cold and hungry.
sentences.chinese: 他們飢寒交迫的上牀睡覺了。

sentences.english: Ashurst bit at his sleeve, to stifle a groan of remorseful longing .
sentences.chinese: 艾舍斯特咬着袖子，抑制悔恨交迫的呻吟。

sentences.english: He was cold and hungry after a week on the run so he gave himself up to the police.
sentences.chinese: 他上路潛逃一個星期後飢寒交迫，只得向警方自首了。

sentences.english: I was cold and hungry some of the time.
sentences.chinese: 在這期間，我曾是飢寒交迫。

sentences.english: Before the liberation, farmer is struggling in suffering hunger and cold.
sentences.chinese: 解放前，農民在飢寒交迫中掙扎着。

sentences.english: Many were starving and freezing in this last winter of the long civil war.
sentences.chinese: 在這內戰最後的冬季，很多人飢寒交迫。

sentences.english: The explorers were faint from hunger and cold.
sentences.chinese: 探險者們因飢寒交迫而委頓不堪。

definition: beset by hunger and cold (idiom)/starving and freezing/in desperate poverty
lit. food not filling the stomach (idiom)/fig. poverty-stricken
hunger cries and cold roars (idiom); wretched poverty
worn out in body and soul (idiom)
the people's livelihood is reduced to destitution (idiom); a time of famine and impoverishment
lit. bleak wind and icy rain (idiom)/fig. hardships/miserable circumstances
